FuncDef:
The attack-source-trace enable command enables attack source tracing.
The undo attack-source-trace enable command disables attack source tracing.
By default, attack source tracing is enabled.

ParaDef.Info:
Records the packets dropped by Committed Access Rate (CAR).
-

Records the packets dropped by management/control plane protection.
-

Records the packets dropped by application layer association.
-

Records information about packets that are dropped when the overall rate at which packets are sent to the CPU exceeds the configured threshold.
You can run the car total-packet { high | low | middle | total-packet-rate } command to set the overall rate at which packets are sent to the CPU.
-

Records the packets dropped by defense against TCP/IP packet attacks.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If you intend to make attack source tracing functions take effect, the attack-source-trace enable command must be enabled. (By default, this command is enabled.)
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
